text: This place has okay food and prices, but customer service is one of the worst I've ever seen. They don't ever smile or act polite, even by your 30th visit. That's not how you treat regular customers. Also very stingy with sauce, extremely unwilling to give extra, and last time I went my meat was completely charred. Needless to say that was my last time ever eating here, they can keep their 1 extra sauce and continue practicing rude customer service if they think it's worth losing a regular customer over it.

The last time I ordered from here, it seemed to be a lot more rice and a lot less chicken in the teriyaki bowl. Also had the California Roll- the thin sliver of avocado left me saying, "boo."  Just an observation.

From out of town, we visit Yogi's every time we come to Vegas, sometimes twice because you have to try the beef, beef ribs, and the veg and shrimp tempura!!! The main thing that sets this restaurant apart from others like it, is everything is cooked fresh after you order, no heat lamps to be found. Fast and friendly service, prices very reasonable.
Love their food here it taste very home made and their chicken and beef and  is so juicy it's amazing the rice too! Love how friendly the employees are! And they cook their food super duper fast.

I was on the other side of town for me and stopped in for a quick bite. I had chicken and beef bowl. The beef was my favorite. I liked that it had an ever so slight char to it. I grabbed two more bowls for friends on the way out. I wish Yogi's was closer to home. I told several friends and will make an excuse to stop back for sure!

The food here is reasonably priced for its portions. I love the huge sushi rolls they sell and would come to this place more often except for one small problem. The lady at the register is extremely rude. She has no customer service skills and has a very dry personality even if you try to be positive with her she is absolutely blank. This is really unfortunate considering the place seemingly has a positive energy. Try not to ask her too many questions about the menu she will get pretty irritated, so after you receive your meal make sure not to listen to the sly comments she makes under her breath as you walk out the door. Be extremely polite to her or she will give you a dirty look. Other than that the food is good but not worth the experience. If she is at the register is rather eat elsewhere.
This place has a pretty good atmosphere and vibe to it. The servers were friendly and got our food out considering there were 3 of us out pretty fast. The yogi plate is something I would recommend
I love this place!!! Whenever I'm not in the mood to cook - my kids & I always go to this place. Their Receptionist/Cashier Naida (I think that's how you spell it) is super nice, too!
Good tasting food. Always ready on time and the staff is friendly! They always give us extra teriyaki with our orders! The side of beef ribs is a little small for the price.

I've been coming here for a little while now, I don't know how I haven't written a review yet! This place is so top notch it's ridiculous. Besides the fact that their prices are crazy cheap, everything is fresh, and they handle a lunch rush like champions. I've never waited more than 5-8 minutes for my food. It's always hot, and steamy, and delicious. The teriyaki sauce they use is a perfect mix of tangy and savory, not super sweet. Tuesday's and Wednesday's you can get a chicken bowl now for like $3.50 all day I think? Come through, it's delicious!
chicken is chopped to bits... and does not cover the whole bowl and its very little... not enough chicken to go with my rice.... this place has watered down sauce......

I look to see pictures and read reviews before I go to the place. Just and FYI the girl that has all the bad reviews no longer works there (I asked), hahaha, but overall the food if good and very filling, the princes are fair. I would recommend to try.

Love yogis. The boyfriend and I love grabbing teriyaki when we don't feel like cooking. Free brown rice, which is always cooked well. Great portions and great teriyaki sauce. Its our go-to place for a lazy night in.
Service is mediocre at best but the food is awesome. Huge portions, full of flavor at a reasonable price.

Free brown rice, free brown rice, free brown rice. FREE!

You're probably thinking "I don't care."  You should care, however, because almost every other place in town charges for it.  Which makes no sense because it's RICE.   

Meat portions and quality are also a steal. A chicken and beef plate (which includes rice and a salad) can easily feed two partially hungry adults for $6.99.  An impossible feat over at Teriyaki Madness.  

The cuts and quality are not bad for the price -- you won't be chowing down on gristle, I promise.  Tempura and gyoza are also on the menu, if you're looking for a little grease.

The restaurant is bare bones in terms of decor but it's located next to a eyebrow threading salon.  Teriyaki and pain, sounds like a night!

I think this will be my last time going there. Its getting obvious that they are cutting corners to save money. My beef teriyaki was kind of rubbery today and once again the meat to rice ratio was out of whack. Yogi's is going down hill.

Is this real life? Am I dreaming? The beef teriyaki bowl here is "slap yo mama" delicious! The sauce here is like no other you've tasted in your life. The meat is so tender-- there is no need to chew...it just melts in your mouth. Stay away from here because this is my secret garden :)

man! I was there two weeks ago with my friend. they food normally are very good, but this time we both got very bad food poisoning!!!!!! so bad that I was sick for two days straight. My friend got suprer sick that couldn't even work, he had to call in sick.............. I would never ever go to this place for sure.

This place is so delicious! I always get the beef and chicken teriyaki. Sometimes I'll throw grilled shrimp and shrimp tempura in. So good you can get addicted! The food is made as you order it so it's always fresh and hot! Doesn't take too long also.

My husband enjoys the Beef and Teriyaki Plate. 

I enjoy the Regular Crunch Roll... However as a sushi lover this should be placed in a "higher class grocery store sushi" than what would get at sushi restaurant or a true Japanese restaurant with a sushi bar included.

The thing we really enjoy from here, oddly enough, (since they are probably order from some food service company), but he wings are really really good!  

Other than the wings and sushi giving them an extra star or two they are on par with the other teriyaki chains around town.
This is my to go spot !!! It's so convenient when I have work because there quick and food is so delicious. I always get the rib plate it's so flavorful it's crazy.
This was the best beef teriyaki bowl I have had. The sauce is delicious. Definitely will be going back for lunch.

Before you read the review, I really wanted to like this p

After reading all the reviews, it was very disappointing after I got my meal. I wasn't expecting out of this world, but at least something good. I walked in and I decided to get the Yogi plate. The portions were great, it was a good amount of beef and chicken teriyaki with rice. I got 4 orange slices which was different and a sad looking iceberg lettuce salad. For the plate and a drink, it was about 12 dollars. The quality wasn't worth it though. It reminded me of a cheap place you get Asian food in the mall. Very plain and lacking of flavor. I would've rather went to a better place and paid 16 dollars to enjoy my meal

The service was great. The lady at the cashier was very friendly and the food came out within 3 minutes.

As a construction worker who frequently works long hours in the sun with constant lifting and sweating there is no better place to come and sit down for 30 mins to an hour and enjoy a perfectly cooked teriaki bowl.

I've been going to Yogis since they opened. I love this place! 

The name of the place explains it all. If you like Teriyaki, you'll love this place!  It's conveniently located 15 to 20 minutes from the Vegas Strip. You can expect a clean restaurant, friendly service, great food, and excellent prices. 

I like to get the Chicken Steak and Veggie combo. The chicken is juicy, the steak is always cooked to perfection, and veggies are delicious.

I highly recommend eating at Yogis

I always get the same thing, but my friends do get other stuff and they agree it is great. I get the chicken teriyaki bowl with breast meat. Not only is it delicious but it is so much food, we always have left overs.

Compared to a place like Samurai Sams, this Yogi's wins hands down. The biggest thing I love about this place is that their rice is always good.

You can have decent cuts of meat and a great salad, but when the meal consists of at least 50% rice, it makes a huge difference whether or not that rice is made right or disgustingly wrong.

The prices are really good, and a plate of food is enough to feed 2 people easily. The best part about this place -- you can order in ahead of time, pick it up within 10 minutes, and be happily eating some good food back at work.
Mediocre.  The chicken plate I ordered was mostly rice.   The salad is iceberg lettuce.   My preference is Teriyaki Madness

One of my favorite places to go. The prices are excellent for the amount of food you receive. The quality does require A BIT more work, but considering the time that it takes vs the amount of customers I'm not to distraught over any of it. They'll continue to have my business for a good long while.

This place is a hidden gem! Great food and the price is pretty good too. The staff was really nice & the teriyaki sauce is amazing and they have $2.99 chicken bowls on Tuesday and Wednesday. Defiantly come check it out if you haven't already!

I really wanted to love this place.  I had read lots of great comments about this place so I suggested it for my weekly lunch date with my guy.  He only has an hour for lunch so this seemed perfect.

He ordered the beef bowl and I ordered the shrimp and veggie bowl.   I love brown rice but it was not an option that day, perhaps they were out.   His bowl was, in his words was good but not great.  The amount of meat vs rice was way out of proportion, he pitched a good amount of rice when he was done. 

Now onto my shrimp and veggie bowl, poor poor shrimp and veggie bowl.  At first glance it looked really good. The tail on shrimp was the perfect pink color you expect from good shrimp and even had a bit of char on the edges.  I couldn't wait to dig in...then my nose was filled with that sulfur smell cabbage gives off.  Not just a wee whiff, but an overwhelming cabbage odor (and for the record I'm an Irish girl, I'd eat cabbage on an old boot but I've never been smacked in the face with this much cabbage-yness before) so my superhero boyfriend came to my rescue and started a cabbage-ectomy.  When he was done my bowl was only 1/3 full...4 shrimp (we'll get to them next) and two small pieces of broccoli and one and a half coins of carrot.  My bowl was literally 2/3 cabbage!  The picture on the menu was not what was handed to me. It should have been called a cabbage bowl. 

There was a saving grace...the shrimp...or so I thought. I picked one up and what looked like a plump perfectly juicy shrimp was those paper thin butterflies shrimp you get on shrimp sushi at an asian buffet. I actually held it up to the light and I could see through it. They tasted of nothing, the tails were floppy. If you are going to charge a couple dollars more than a beef dish (with a good bit of beef in the dish) you better give me more than 4 see through shrimp and a metric ton of cabbage. 

The two stars are one each for not screwing up the rice and for really good teriyaki sauce that wasn't super thick and cloyingly sweet. If I could get a jar of that stuff I'd pay for it then take it home and make some amazing teriyaki shrimp...those giant suckers (jumbo shrimp is probably my favorite oxymoron next to military intelligence, but I digress).  In this story I was the poor sucker who paid 8 ish bucks for a bowl o' rice and cabbage. I totally hear you laughing at me!

First time coming here.  I first noticed how clean this place is and how friendly the staff is
They offered suggestions based on what we were debating to try.  They also helped me with the entire process of getting the rewards app set up. 
Food was ready quickly and tasted fresh.  Would definitely recommend!

For me, this is the best teriyaki place in vegas valley. I've been to a lot of teriyaki places, some even advertises, but none that I could find is as good as this place's teriyaki. The price are reasonable and portions are big.

Incredibly delicious teriyaki beef plate! 
My husband is super addicted to it. They must sprinkle it with cocaine or something lol jay kay :)

Found this place on Yelp while visiting from California. Saw the good ratings and decided to give it a try. Great service! Food was good, ordered the beef and chicken teriyaki with veggies. All tasty, and would definitely come back should we be in town.
My FAVORITE teriyaki place in Vegas. The best teriyaki sauce and the meat is cooked just right. Plus, you get a lot for the price you pay.
The food here is simple and tasty.... a bit pricey but it's a bit more settling on the stomach than eating panda express or long john silvers.
By far the best teriyaki place in town! Better than flame broiler or teriyaki madness! Amazing salad and teriyaki sauce made by them! Definitely would recommend to everyone!

Great food, quick service! If you're craving a teriyaki chicken bowl that's a perfect portion for lunch, stop by here! 

I ordered their ridiculously priced chicken teriyaki bowl special for $6.98! That includes a small teriyaki chicken bowl with rice and a fountain drink. My husband ordered the large portion, of course.

Also, their shrimp tempura is very good. Like other reviewers stated, the batter is very light and doesn't overwhelm the shrimp. Basically, you actually get half shrimp and half batter in each bite instead of the usual all batter and no shrimp bite!

Lastly, when my husband and I went, the staff that worked that day were openly dedicated and friendly. Their outdoor sign displaying the chicken bowl special fell over and one worker immediately went out and set it up again. Small things like that earn brownie points with me.

For those looking for a decent teriyaki place, this is it.

Skip all the fast food places that surround this place. These guys are kind of hidden in the back. But once you find it, your taste buds and stomach will thank you later. For those that are familiar with Flame Broiler in So Cal, these guys are pretty similar.

What I got was the #11 Chicken and Beef Combo Plate with Vegetables and Brown Rice. Right away I am liking the fact that they don't charge you extra for the brown rice. The vegetables, which they give you good portions of, are consisted of broccoli, cabbage, and sliced carrots. 

The teriyaki sauce they have there are in big squeeze bottles. They also have sriracha for you spice heads. They have many other choices besides chicken and beef like short ribs, fish, tempura, miso soup, and California rolls.


Prices are a bit cheaper than Teriyaki Madness and their customer service is very good.

Too bad this is the only location they have because I live over by Aliante and this is kind of a drive for me so im jealous of those that work and/or live around this area.

I wish I can give this joint 6 stars!  Ive been going to Yogi's since I moved here bout 4 yrs ago.  When my best bud introduced me to this place.  Ive had various teriyaki places around vegas and Cali.  Teriyaki madness, Yoshinoyas, etc etc. And YYogi's by far is the best.

When out-of-towners some in, I usually take them out there and no one has ever complained.  After our meal I can tell there good by that "Dang son this is some good teriyaki" look they get.

I recommend good ol combo #6 as it comes with Beef and chicken and a green leafy side thing.  I believe yall call it salad.  Its actually tasty.  A good hearty lunch/dinner thats under 10 bones. 

Go there, or ill punch you in the face.

First time to Yogis and the food was just...okay. Got the small chicken/beef bowl. The bowl looked kind of small but they don't have a medium size and the large size is way too big. I guess thats how they get you to upgrade to a large. Chicken was good and beef was good as well. The beef had the right amount of marinade but the chicken probably could have been marinated a little longer. The sauce was semi-sweet and just had the right mixture of salty and sweet. Food wise it's not a bad place, but it just didn't blow me away or anything. The reason for the 3 stars was that when I ordered my food, the cook dropped some meat on the counter and put it in my bowl. Knowing that counters can get pretty dirty I asked for another bowl and the cashier and cook seemed kind of annoyed by it. Besides that, it's just your typical teriyaki place. Decent food, probably won't be back though.

Need a quick, cheap lunch? Need to feel like you're trying to be somewhat healthy? Need crazy, big portions? You've found your new go-to lunch spot. For extra attempt at healthiness, go for brown rice, chicken teriyaki (without extra sauce) and steamed veggies. 

This place is all about getting you food fast. Even if you order in-person, your food will come out relatively quickly. If you call ahead, your food should be ready in about 10 minutes, even during a lunch rush. Parking can be in demand in this area, but just park near KFC/Taco Bell and walk a little bit, and feel good that you aren't getting fast food.

Delicious chicken teriyaki bowl. The rice is perfectly cooked. The chicken is tender and moist. The teriyaki sauce is deliciously mild sweet. We come here on weekdays after spin class and we feel good after eating here.

The number one reason I go here is for the salad that comes with.  The dressing is very memorable!

I usually get  the plate here with teriyaki chicken, teriyaki beef and teriyaki shrimp.  It also comes with rice, the salad (so good!) and two orange wedges.

The staff is friendly.  The place is clean, even the rest rooms.  There is plenty of seating and their portions are generous.

Don't let my review make up your mind for you.  Just drive by the store front and roll the window down... I bet that'll be enough for you to park and hurry in!
Very nice stuff, clean establishment good food and responsible prices. It's a winner in my book

I don't even like teriyaki but this place was really good.  I ate the chicken and beef bowl which was really good. Their tempura is really light and not greasy. Better than most high end Japanese places I have been to. They keep their place clean, just the way I like it.

best food ever!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
great price great food!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
worst drive! hahaha i hate that its so far away... but WORTH THE DRIVE!

This review is for 3.5 stars.  

Yogi's has a solid terriyaki bowl for comparable prices to other terriyaki places and fast casual in general.  Most of their meals run from $6 to $10 and they have chicken, steak, salmon, and a few other options, either in a bowl or just vegetables.  They also have sushi for pretty cheap, but I didn't try it.

Yogi's is very comparable to the up-and-coming terriyaki bowl type of fast food.  It has prompt service, the meat was uniquely cut and marinated, and it looked like they were sponsored by sriracha which I am a fan of for a nice kick.  The terriyaki sauce was average and the vegetables were a little watery, but I thought the actual beef portion was better than most other comparable spots.

I wouldn't say Yogi's is hands down the best terriyaki in town, but it's a solid option for a nice, filling lunch in the Summerlin area.

Starting to go down hill ... more rice , less meat.   The chicken was dry and the beef kind of flavorless.  I love the teriyaki sauce better than teriyaki madness , but i feel as they are trying to save money... and its hurting the quality of their food.

Don't come here looking for the positive attitude of Yogi Bear. Nope...here at Yogi's Teriyaki you will be greeted like a stranger bothering their business by simply stepping up to order. Watch as the non-chef chef's pull some lukewarm meat out of the warming containers next to the grill. See them prepare dried out beef and chicken jerky on their dry grill; all the while smelling burning meat. Then watch as they don't put it fresh on your plate; rather straight into the warming pot to the left of the grill. When you finally get your food, it's of course luke warm and not fresh; because it too came out of the holding warmer. The food was boring, tasteless unless you soaked it in Teriyaki sauce at your table. Now back to the service without a smile, without a care, and without respect for your few and far between customers. Personally I think that you need to seriously re-visit your recipes, your reason for being in business, and greet and treat your guests like royalty. They are after all your single source of success! Your food should be flavorful, fresh, piping hot and stop cutting your meats so damn thin that we have to be 90 years old to eat it. If you cannot serve them fresh tasty food with warmth and care; then shut it down and save yourselves! I really wanted to like your establishment and food, but sadly it tasted like something a child would make in a blender. GROSS, NO VALUE $$, NO LOVE, NO CARE, NO CUSTOMERS...

Such a horrible yelper..been coming for awhile now. Great little spot for a good lunch. Don't forget the tempura. 

The portions are a great size in my opinion. I have tried everything there except the shrimp and have no complaints. My personal favorite is the chicken/beef bowl with vegetables.

DO NOT USE YOUR DEBIT CARD HERE! I ate at Yogi's for the first time on December 20th, and two days later over $600 in fraudulent LOCAL charges hit my account from Walmart, Walgreens, and Redbox. B of A Fraud Department believes the fraud originated at Yogi's. There is an open investigation involving B of A and Metro. BE WARNED! Don't let yourself be victimized. This establishment obviously hires people with compromised values who are capable of robbing people right before Christmas.

Been here a few times now and look forward to coming out this way since yogis is here. My husband told me about this place and I have never been disappointed! The brown rice is always cooked perfect along with the grilled chicken (never dry). My favorite is a small beef and chicken veggie brown rice bowl with less rice and more veggies. Soooo good!! The beef is fantastic!! Yum!
Great fresh tempura and love their homemade teriyaki sauce. The teriyaki bowl special on Tuesday and Wednesday are a great deal. A new fav of mine.
i only go for the crunch rolls & they are delicious & affordable & suuuuper filling! love it there! can't wait to try more!

The food is amazing here! The small bowl is a perfect portion. My favorite is the all chicken one, but I occasionally get the half beef/half chicken one. I always order a head of time since it can take a while to prepare the food. But, that does not make this place any less amazing. Also, pour the extra teriyaki sauce and siracha on your meal, you won't regret it!

This is my go to place whenever I'm on my own for lunch or dinner (the boyfriend isn't a big fan of teriyaki) It's quick, it's close, and it's good and you get big portions at a decent price. 

I love the teriyaki chicken and veggies. I've also had the tempura. . . not my fav, but not too bad either.

Great teriyaki place; seems a bit better than Teriyaki Madness.

I really enjoy the teriyaki beef, then the chicken, but I wasn't a big fan of the shrimp.

We don't come here too much but today we drove out of our way for this.
We ordered the beef and chicken veggie plate (veggie means it comes with brocolli and carrots not salad? weird, isn't it the same?)
It's was $20 total which isn't bad since they give you a ton of food.
The chicken is always cooked perfection, not over done and dry at all but the beef is very interesting to say the least. It looks black and kind of tastes like it's been burnt but then it doesn't? I don't know how to describe it but now I remember why I always order just the chicken. Also under the meat the load on the rice. The one thing I love here is the fact they have teriyaki sauce and sarachi by the bottle so you can get as much as you want! 
It looks like they also added wings onto their menu
12 for $9.99 and I think they only had two flavors, and I see no sign for fries? Rice with your wings haha no thanks!
i used to work across the street and call in my order. sadly, they knew me over the phone. now, i seldom come in but its still the bomb. large beef veggie all day.

Good price. Good amount and good food. Kind of like Teriyaki madness but I cheaper version. But it is a good quick go to place. Def will be coming here !! Also I figured out that on tuesdays and Wednesday it's half off ! Yummy. Love it here !

If you are looking for straightforward, affordable, quick, but mouthwatering teriyaki, this is it. I look forward to being in West Vegas specifically so I have an excuse to eat here. This place is bomb

I think this place is still good, I would say pay attention to your receipt though, sometimes mistakes happen, they over charge on accident at times.

Other than that great the food is great and not bad on prices. The owner does take care of the problems if there is any, awesome place.
The best place for me when I need my teriyaki fix. I always get chicken-veggie. Tried beef once, was all chewy. Fast service like everyone says.

Lunch special on Tuesday and Wednesday. 
Chicken bowl with veggies for $4.29, which is plenty of food for the price.  
Chicken was moist and teriyaki sauce was flavorful.  The veggies were cooked to perfection.  The carrots and broccolis were soft just the way I like it
 Yumz

Can't even rate the food because no matter how great it might be - it's gonna suck due to the horrible experience I'm already having. First my fiancé & I check out the menu on yelp as normal & pick our stuff. Since everything I'd made to order we didn't attempt to get pick up- I went & waited. But soon as i get here the stuff we want doesn't exist on the menu! Ask the girl & she claims people are messing with them lol ooook why would yelp have your exact address with a nice high rating just to "mess with you" ?! I'm confused but I choose from the available menu that states their teriyaki bowls are "served over white or brown rice
With steamed veggies including cabbage, carrots & broccoli- All white meat available for additional $1.25 All steamed veggies available for additional .59cents) 
Idk how but somehow when I ordered a large all white meat chicken bowl & a large rib meat bowl - my receipt said 'double rice' under the chicken bowl & 'double veg' under the beef bowl. Confused again, I asked the girl why aren't these just normal with veggies & rice & AGAIN she gave me some BULLSHIT. Now I sit waiting for my order, & I notice I've been overcharged on both bowls! $8.83 for the chicken bowl that should be 
 $6.08 +$1.25= $7.33
AND 
$9.99 for the beef rib bowl that cost 
$7.08
Look'n at the menu I just realized she charges me for plates NOT bowls like I asked for - I'm So piss'd right now

I used to come here quite often when I used to live in the neighborhood, and I remember how good it was. So I decided to introduce it to my boyfriend. We went on Saturday, 8/22/14, and he really liked it. I had a chicken bowl and he had a chicken/beef plate. We thought everything was great until he ended up in the hospital the next day for food poisoning. I got a stomach ache after a few hours of eating and took medicine right away which I believe is the reason that saved me the trip to the hospital. But as I'm typing this, my stomach is still upset. It hit him about 12 hours later after our meal, so we figured it was from Yogi's since this was the only place we ate together on Saturday. The next day we found out that someone we know also got food poisoning from here. I thought it was a one time thing, so it could've been forgivable. Never coming back. Save yourself a night of throwing up and no sleep. Please don't come here.

I been going to this place for years. They have only got my order wrong once. Very balanced portions! You can call ahead and they will get the order ready for you. I will say this place is a little pricey, but still a great place to eat. Also, it is big enough on the inside so you can eat there if needed.
Solid! Good sized portions, decent quality meat. Better than Samurai Sam's.
Great teriyaki!!!!! The best teriyaki I have had since moving from Portland. I highly recommend the tempura veggies and teriyaki beef.

We used to come here often way before Yelp was around and it has changed. I read some of the reviews about people saying how great the portion size are. I must've warped into the future when minimum wage is $15/hr because all I got was a bowl full of rice and a thin layer of meat laid on top (chicken/beef). The meat must've been less than a quarter pound before cooking and the beef was almost all fat. I really wished I took pics of how measly the meat portion size was. For the same amount spent, I'm going to Samaurai Sams or Teryaki Madness.

I really want to give them a 1 Star, but service was decent. Portion size = BAD. If you look at my review history, I usually rate places high. Sorry Yogi's.....you just couldn't make the cut. I really am that annoyed after looking at the pictures other people posted and compared to what you have served me today.

This is by far my favorite teriyaki place ESPECIALLY THE BEEF PLATE!! The chicken is pretty good to They previously had a cashier that never smiled which is real let down And prevented me from going there more  cause it made me feel bad  But i think she is gone cause i haven't seen her in awhile The new one is smiling and make you feel a lot more welcomed If you like teriyaki places this is the one you have to try The beef is char grilled so it gives the extra flavor By the far the BEST IN TOWN! BLOWS teriyaki madness IMO!

My family and I have enjoyed take out from Yogi's for years and the quality of their food is always as expected. Their portions are great for the price!

Simply put, if you want some good teriyaki, Yogi's will not disappoint!

this place is DANK

cheap, good quality chicken and beef teriyaki with rice and salad...
the tempura is bomb also. only 6 bucks for the tempura...

The meat was so so. Some places have good meat and others don't. This is the latter.  Not sure how freshly cooked it was either. Maybe this place is better during a rush hour. Can't remember the bowl I had, bit it was the beef, chicken and shrimp one. The shrimp was ice cold.

Love this place! Been coming here since '07. Everything here is good; my fave is their teriyaki beef(very flavorful, tender). Their teriyaki sauce is different from the other teriyaki joints and is the best! Too bad we live far away, otherwise we would be here regularly.

I've been coming here for years and love it. I have cravings for the chicken beef plate all the time. Drink prices a bit crazy but convince store right there. Always good, quick, clean and nice people. Loyal customer for life as long as quality is maintained.

I was trying this place out today for the first time. I had ordered the yogis plate with tempura vegetables. After I had paid I saw the cook pull pre cooked beef & chicken from the hotline and on to the grill, I'm assuming just to char the meat. My order was prepared really fast (not to complain). I know "sand bagging" is a convenient way, but I can't complain on the price. Great taste, just wished it was fresher.

This place is awsome!!!! I have been looking for some good teriyaki in town. And I just found the right place. Price & Service as fast food joint, but their quality and taste is 5 star. I tried the Yogis Plate so that I can taste all of what they have to offer. My wife tried the B.B.Q. Short ribs and they are excellent. I have been going to Yogis since, and all my family and friends that I have introduced loves it. I was told the tempura was freshly battered and taste no other.  

If you are tired of same fast food , try this joint out.

Avg place, not great, certainly not bad at all.  It's a simple rice and chicken or beef terriyaki place.  The beef was very good. Oh and they have brown rice as an option (no extra charge)  and I enjoyed it very much
I love coming here but yesterday I took it to go and I found a long piece of brown hair in my food. So very disappointed :(

Very good teri chicken for fast food on the go.  Great attitude from the staff too.  Miso soup is excellent for a fast food joint too.  Have yet to try tempura though.  But so far the salad, chicken teri have been great for a simple dinner/lunch.  Great neighborhood eat.

Reasonable prices for quality food

I always order a Large Beef and Buffalo wings 
And they never disappoint 

Taste is always great and the Buffalo wings are done just right a nice crunch to the outside and a nice tender chicken inside.

Good basic teriyaki. I like the all white meat chicken teriyaki. Comes with plenty of food for a large meal or two small ones. Orders come up pretty quick and taste great. Will definitely be back!

UPDATE 9/15/2012:
I'm now a regular here. Still a great place to come if you're hungry and craving some delicious teriyaki. Lots of bang for your buck. The wife likes their beef teriyaki too!

I'm having a hard time rating this one because of the rice. Does that sound ridiculous? My boss from time to time will treat me to lunch and this is one of the places we had lunch at this past week. 

For starters, we always take it to go so we don't have any time to really get served. What I can say about the cashier is that he is very accommodating with offering extra Teriyaki sauce and chili sauce, and points out where the napkins, forks and spoons are. When we order over the phone, the voice always sounds so welcoming and friendly. 

I ordered Yogi's plate. The shrimp was a disappointment as the three were super small and butterflied for the effect of largeness - which did not succeed. As for the rice, not so good. for some reason, it goes hard after a few minutes and doesn't taste like the other Japanese rice I'm accustomed to. Cheap version perhaps? Although, the beef and chicken were full of flavor and goodness. I was very impressed with the taste of the meat. I was also in favor of their salad. The dressing tasted home made. Oh, I also ordered Shrimp Tempura which was very good. I would order this over and over again. I think this was my favorite in the whole menu. 

After reading my review, I have more pros on it than cons. I'm a fan of the service, meats, salad, and shrimp tempura. I'm not a fan of the dinky butterflied shrimp, and rice.

Okay, I had this on 4 stars, but after thinking about it I just can't keep it at that.  I have to give it a 3 stars.  I'm just not convinced with the rice.  :(  Sorry.

One of the few places I would recommend the beef over the chicken.  Somehow it feels lighter.  But the portions are huge and the veggies are fresh!

I love this place.  It could be cheaper but I would rather pay the price up front instead of getting nickel'd and dime'd at samurai sams and Teriyaki Madness.
Best teriyaki on this side of town! Fast friendly service. Eat here all the time. Sign up for the Belly card and earn points towards free goodies. Highly recommend!!
Love this place!  They have the best teri beef around.  And their spicy California rolls are quite tasty.
this place used to be so good but now the portions are small. i really got this as "shrimp tempura". disappointing

Excellent, fresh food at a great price. Two little reasons it's only four stars and not five--my daughter got way too much teriyaki sauce on her beef, so it was a little overwhelming for her. Better to start with less, especially since they offer nice big bottles of sauce on the side. Second, the music was playing too loud! Combine that with a group of guys trying to talk over the music at the table next to us, and I had an insta-headache and wanted out of there. I will most definitely be getting this tasty food again--but only to go.

Great spot for some beef or chicken teriyaki platters.  The food is consistent and fresh.  Only concern is how the meats are chopped up very finely as opposed to most places that have larger chunks of meat.  I enjoy the mixed yogis plate with chicken and beef and rice plus salad and orange.  Just started using the brown rice substitute as a healthy alternative.  Sometimes I'll get the fried potstickers when I'm super hungry or craving them.  Nothing special about the potstickers as I've had authentic and better ones elsewhere.  Convenient location on the west side of town near Tropicana and the 215.  Shopping center doesn't have much parking for the amount of businesses and restaurants.  Yogis is great after a long night out and you're craving some quick delicious teriyaki!

I came in about 15 minutes after they had opened and i tried to order the cali crunch roll they told me that item wouldn't be ready for at least 1 hr and they also told me to call first before coming there to get that item to make sure they have it.  So now i am here to try it and they have it but have to wait for them to make it.

I recommend eating here. They even offer brown rice as a substitution to the white rice! Service is friendly here, and the foods great too. I came with my GF and we order a chicken/beef plate, and a need rib plate. They even cook in the front of house so you know it's fresh! Will be coming back

Came in here yesterday for lunch after a good workout. Was very impressed by the clean quaint atmosphere. Their combo plate was amazing and perfectly portioned for my husband and I! Fast service and reasonable pricing. The food was delicious. Will definitely be stopping in again to fill up:)

I'm giving this place 4 stars instead of 5 because it's over priced... I chose this place because it's near my best friends office and I have been craving teriyaki chicken... For a large to go box it was over $7 which includes on the food, no drink. I prefer Sakura on west Craig but it's out if the way.... Besides the prices that food was actually really good and I will eat here again when ever I'm visiting my friend

Better than the chains around here, Yogi's uses slightly better meat and I prefer their teriyaki sauce.  While you can upgrade to all white meat I don't need to here, there is still a mix of both, and the plates are HUGE- way more than one meal.  My fiancé used to live over this way and we still make a point to stop here on the way home from red rock hikes now that we live across town.

I was tired of eating from the fast food places near my house, so I decided to give Yogi's Teriyaki House a try. This place reminds me of the Flame Broiler locations I used to order take out from when I lived in California. They offer a pretty simple menu with your choice of Teriyaki bowls and plates, Tempura, Salads, and a few sushi rolls. 

I decided to get the Chicken & Beef Plate. It was pretty good and they give you a good portion. It even comes with a small garden salad and sliced oranges. My only complaint is that some of the beef was kind of fatty so I had to throw those pieces away. But overall it was full of flavor and kept me full!

Fast service, clean, and reasonable prices. They employees were friendly as well. They offered me extra teriyaki and hot sauce even though I didn't need it. I'll definitely be back!

The teriyaki here was ok. I came by for takeout and ordered the chicken and steak teriyaki combination plate. The servers were quick and I was out the door quickly. 

The food was decent, but the meat was cut a little differently than most. It was chopped into smaller pieces which I didn't love. The sauce was a little sweeter and thicker than I like, but overall the food was good.
